channel.title: VPS vs Own Computer Hosting
channel.description:
I've looked about and its seems to be the standard for VPS is about 1.5gb RAM and like 1Ghz processor. My computer has 8gb ram and 3.2ghz processor...
Which would be a better host? I understand my computer's numbers are definately better, but would there be a reason to VPS taking the cake? And could I please get a rough estimate on how many players each could handle?
-Thanks! :D

item.title: VPS vs Own Computer Hosting
item.dc:creator: @gravenfire23 gravenfire23
item.description:
@gravenfire23 wrote:

[quote=“Butchd12, post:9, topic:382649”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=478443.msg3502146#msg3502146 date=1297818898]

100.0 mbps good enough?
[/quote]How much do you pay for your internet?
Most moparscaper’s don’t get past 30 mb/s for download, or 10 mb/s for upload. :S

My grandma pays like 60-75 a month for internet and hers is 100.0 mb/s. But then again different providers give different prices[/quote]

Mind posting a picture?

Read full topic

item.title: VPS vs Own Computer Hosting
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Keepaforlife:

So Im not gonna pay more than like 20/30$ a month for a VPS, and for what Ive researched the 1.5gb/1ghz is about what that’ll give me, Im not aiming to pay 100$ or more for something.

That depends on the amount of members on the server. You can use the personal computer.

Read full topic

item.title: VPS vs Own Computer Hosting
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

Vps’s are usualy better for Connectivity, But Computers have better stability In Most cases I can’t say for sure because i can’t compare them because you didnt post information.

Read full topic

item.title: VPS vs Own Computer Hosting
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Depending on the kind of VPS one obtains, the VPS could be better. This also depends on the kind of VPS one gets, I would say for example; getting a linux with the same amount of space as stated above, over your computer.

Though, I don’t know which brand of VPS you are talking about, so your computer at the moment is better.

Read full topic
